trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight with PowerShell | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight with PowerShell | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to perform administrative tasks for the Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to perform administrative tasks for the Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to manage Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight by using a local Azure PowerShell console through the use of Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to manage Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight by using a local Azure PowerShell console through the use of Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For the list of the HDInsight PowerShell cmdlets, see <linkText>HDInsight cmdlet reference[hdinsight-powershell-reference]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the list of the HDInsight PowerShell cmdlets, see <linkText>HDInsight cmdlet reference[hdinsight-powershell-reference]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The PowerShell scripts provided in this article uses the Azure resource manager mode.
trans-unit.target: The PowerShell scripts provided in this article uses the Azure resource manager mode.

trans-unit.source: To ensure the samples work for you, please download the latest Azure PowerShell using the Microsoft Web Platform Installer.
trans-unit.target: To ensure the samples work for you, please download the latest Azure PowerShell using the Microsoft Web Platform Installer.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters require a Azure Resource group and a Blob container on an Azure Storage account:
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters require a Azure Resource group and a Blob container on an Azure Storage account:

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource group is a logical container for Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource group is a logical container for Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: The Azure resource group and the HDInsight cluster don't have to be in the same location.
trans-unit.target: The Azure resource group and the HDInsight cluster don't have to be in the same location.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses a Blob container of an Azure Storage account as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses a Blob container of an Azure Storage account as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage account and a storage container are required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage account and a storage container are required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The default storage account and the HDInsight cluster have to be in the same location.
trans-unit.target: The default storage account and the HDInsight cluster have to be in the same location.

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure resource group
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure resource group

trans-unit.source: Ensure you are in the Azure resource mode:
trans-unit.target: Ensure you are in the Azure resource mode:

trans-unit.source: Connect to you Azure account and select a subscription (in case you have multiple subscriptions).
trans-unit.target: Connect to you Azure account and select a subscription (in case you have multiple subscriptions).

trans-unit.source: Create a new resource group:
trans-unit.target: Create a new resource group:

trans-unit.source: New-AzureResourceGroup -name <AzureResourceGroupName> -Location <AzureDataCente> # For example, "West US"
trans-unit.target: New-AzureResourceGroup -name <AzureResourceGroupName> -Location <AzureDataCente> # For example, "West US"

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: For information on creating an Azure Storage account by using the Azure preview portal, see <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information on creating an Azure Storage account by using the Azure preview portal, see <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you have already had a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following commands to retrieve the information:
trans-unit.target: If you have already had a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following commands to retrieve the information:

trans-unit.source: For details on getting the information by using the preview portal, see the "View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys" section of <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details on getting the information by using the preview portal, see the "View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys" section of <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure storage container
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure storage container

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell cannot create a Blob container during the HDInsight provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell cannot create a Blob container during the HDInsight provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: You can create one by using the following script:
trans-unit.target: You can create one by using the following script:

trans-unit.source: To provision a cluster
trans-unit.target: To provision a cluster

trans-unit.source: Once you have the Storage account and the Blob container prepared, you are ready to create a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once you have the Storage account and the Blob container prepared, you are ready to create a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to list all clusters in the current subscription:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to list all clusters in the current subscription:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to show details of a specific cluster in the current subscription:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to show details of a specific cluster in the current subscription:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to delete a cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to delete a cluster:

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters have the following HTTP web services (all of these services have RESTful endpoints):
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters have the following HTTP web services (all of these services have RESTful endpoints):

trans-unit.source: ODBC
trans-unit.target: ODBC

trans-unit.source: JDBC
trans-unit.target: JDBC

trans-unit.source: Ambari
trans-unit.target: Ambari

trans-unit.source: Oozie
trans-unit.target: Oozie

trans-unit.source: Templeton
trans-unit.target: Templeton

trans-unit.source: By default, these services are granted for access.
trans-unit.target: By default, these services are granted for access.

trans-unit.source: You can revoke/grant the access.
trans-unit.target: You can revoke/grant the access.

trans-unit.source: Here is a sample:
trans-unit.target: Here is a sample:

trans-unit.source: In the sample, hdiv2 is an HDInsight cluster name.
trans-unit.target: In the sample, hdiv2 is an HDInsight cluster name.

trans-unit.source: By granting/revoking the access, you will reset the cluster user name and password.
trans-unit.target: By granting/revoking the access, you will reset the cluster user name and password.

trans-unit.source: This can also be done via the preview portal.
trans-unit.target: This can also be done via the preview portal.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Administer HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal[hdinsight-admin-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Administer HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal[hdinsight-admin-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The cluster scaling feature allows you to change the number of worker nodes used by a cluster that is running in Azure HDInsight without having to re-create the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The cluster scaling feature allows you to change the number of worker nodes used by a cluster that is running in Azure HDInsight without having to re-create the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Only clusters with HDInsight version 3.1.3 or higher are supported.
trans-unit.target: Only clusters with HDInsight version 3.1.3 or higher are supported.

trans-unit.source: If you are unsure of the version of your cluster, you can check the Properties page.
trans-unit.target: If you are unsure of the version of your cluster, you can check the Properties page.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get familiar with the cluster portal interface</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get familiar with the cluster portal interface</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The impact of changing the number of data nodes for each type of cluster supported by HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: The impact of changing the number of data nodes for each type of cluster supported by HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: Hadoop
trans-unit.target: Hadoop

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly increase the number of worker nodes in a Hadoop cluster that is running without impacting any pending or running jobs.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly increase the number of worker nodes in a Hadoop cluster that is running without impacting any pending or running jobs.

trans-unit.source: New jobs can also be submitted while the operation is in progress.
trans-unit.target: New jobs can also be submitted while the operation is in progress.

trans-unit.source: Failures in a scaling operation are gracefully handled so that the cluster is always left in a functional state.
trans-unit.target: Failures in a scaling operation are gracefully handled so that the cluster is always left in a functional state.

trans-unit.source: When a Hadoop cluster is scaled down by reducing the number of data nodes, some of the services in the cluster are restarted.
trans-unit.target: When a Hadoop cluster is scaled down by reducing the number of data nodes, some of the services in the cluster are restarted.

trans-unit.source: This causes all running and pending jobs to fail at the completion of the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: This causes all running and pending jobs to fail at the completion of the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: You can, however, resubmit the jobs once the operation is complete.
trans-unit.target: You can, however, resubmit the jobs once the operation is complete.

trans-unit.source: HBase
trans-unit.target: HBase

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly add or remove nodes to your HBase cluster while it is running.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly add or remove nodes to your HBase cluster while it is running.

trans-unit.source: Regional Servers are automatically balanced within a few minutes of completing the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: Regional Servers are automatically balanced within a few minutes of completing the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: However, you can also manually balance the regional servers by logging into the headnode of cluster and running the following commands from a command prompt window:
trans-unit.target: However, you can also manually balance the regional servers by logging into the headnode of cluster and running the following commands from a command prompt window:

trans-unit.source: pushd %HBASE_HOME%\bin hbase shell balancer
trans-unit.target: pushd %HBASE_HOME%\bin hbase shell balancer

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the HBase shell, see []
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the HBase shell, see []

trans-unit.source: Storm
trans-unit.target: Storm

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly add or remove data nodes to your Storm cluster while it is running.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly add or remove data nodes to your Storm cluster while it is running.

trans-unit.source: But after a successful completion of the scaling operation, you will need to rebalance the topology.
trans-unit.target: But after a successful completion of the scaling operation, you will need to rebalance the topology.

trans-unit.source: Rebalancing can be accomplished in two ways:
trans-unit.target: Rebalancing can be accomplished in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Storm web UI
trans-unit.target: Storm web UI

trans-unit.source: Command-line interface (CLI) tool
trans-unit.target: Command-line interface (CLI) tool

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the <linkText>Apache Storm documentation</linkText><title></title> for more details.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the <linkText>Apache Storm documentation</linkText><title></title> for more details.

trans-unit.source: The Storm web UI is available on the HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: The Storm web UI is available on the HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>hdinsight storm scale rebalance</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>hdinsight storm scale rebalance</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Here is an example how to use the CLI command to rebalance the Storm topology:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example how to use the CLI command to rebalance the Storm topology:

trans-unit.source: To change the Hadoop cluster size by using Azure PowerShell, run the following command from a client machine:
trans-unit.target: To change the Hadoop cluster size by using Azure PowerShell, run the following command from a client machine:

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight cluster distribution comes with some MapReduce samples.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight cluster distribution comes with some MapReduce samples.

trans-unit.source: One of the samples is for counting word frequencies in source files.
trans-unit.target: One of the samples is for counting word frequencies in source files.

trans-unit.source: To submit a MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: To submit a MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: The following Azure PowerShell script submits the word-count sample job:
trans-unit.target: The following Azure PowerShell script submits the word-count sample job:

trans-unit.source: For information about the wasb prefix, see Use Azure Blob storage for HDInsight[hdinsight-storage].
trans-unit.target: For information about the wasb prefix, see Use Azure Blob storage for HDInsight[hdinsight-storage].

trans-unit.source: To download the MapReduce job output
trans-unit.target: To download the MapReduce job output

trans-unit.source: The following Azure PowerShell script retrieves the MapReduce job output from the last procedure:
trans-unit.target: The following Azure PowerShell script retrieves the MapReduce job output from the last procedure:

trans-unit.source: For more information on developing and running MapReduce jobs, see <linkText>Using MapReduce with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-mapreduce]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on developing and running MapReduce jobs, see <linkText>Using MapReduce with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-mapreduce]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight cluster distribution comes with a sample Hive table called hivesampletable.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight cluster distribution comes with a sample Hive table called hivesampletable.

trans-unit.source: You can use a HiveQL SHOW TABLES command to list the Hive tables on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can use a HiveQL SHOW TABLES command to list the Hive tables on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: To submit a Hive job
trans-unit.target: To submit a Hive job

trans-unit.source: The following script submits a Hive job to list the Hive tables:
trans-unit.target: The following script submits a Hive job to list the Hive tables:

trans-unit.source: The Hive job will first show the Hive tables created on the cluster, and the data returned from the hivesampletable table.
trans-unit.target: The Hive job will first show the Hive tables created on the cluster, and the data returned from the hivesampletable table.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Hive, see <linkText>Using Hive with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-hive]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Hive, see <linkText>Using Hive with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-hive]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Upload data to HDInsight[hdinsight-upload-data]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Submit MapReduce jobs</linkText><title></title> section in this article.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Submit MapReduce jobs</linkText><title></title> section in this article.
